013package org.apache.juneau.http.header;
014
015import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
016
017import org.apache.http.Header;
018import org.apache.http.HeaderIterator;
019import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
020
021/**
022 * Basic implementation of a {@link HeaderIterator}.
023 *
024 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
025 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe.
026 * </ul>
027 *
028 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
029 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#juneau-rest-common">juneau-rest-common</a>
030 *    <li class='extlink'><a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.html">Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1</a>
031 * </ul>
032 */
033public class BasicHeaderIterator implements HeaderIterator {
034
035   private final Header[] entries;
036   private final String name;
037   private final boolean caseSensitive;
038
039   private int currentIndex;
040
041   /**
042    * Creates a new header iterator.
043    *
044    * @param headers An array of headers over which to iterate.
045    * @param name The name of the headers over which to iterate, or <jk>null</jk> for all.
046    * @param caseSensitive Use case-sensitive matching for part name.
047    */
048   public BasicHeaderIterator(Header[] headers, String name, boolean caseSensitive) {
049      this.entries = Utils.assertArgNotNull("headers", headers);
050      this.name = name;
051      this.caseSensitive = caseSensitive;
052      this.currentIndex = findNext(-1);
053   }
054
055   private int findNext(int pos) {
056
057      int from = pos;
058
059      int to = entries.length - 1;
060      boolean found = false;
061      while (!found && (from < to)) {
062         from++;
063         found = filter(from);
064      }
065
066      return found ? from : -1;
067   }
068
069   private boolean filter(int index) {
070      return (name == null) || eq(name, entries[index].getName());
071   }
072
073   @Override /* HeaderIterator */
074   public boolean hasNext() {
075      return (currentIndex >= 0);
076   }
077
078   @Override /* HeaderIterator */
079   public Header nextHeader() throws NoSuchElementException {
080
081      int current = currentIndex;
082
083      if (current < 0)
084         throw new NoSuchElementException("Iteration already finished.");
085
086      currentIndex = findNext(current);
087
088      return entries[current];
089   }
090
091   @Override /* HeaderIterator */
092   public final Object next() throws NoSuchElementException {
093      return nextHeader();
094   }
095
096   /**
097    * Not supported.
098    */
099   @Override /* HeaderIterator */
100   public void remove() {
101      throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not supported.");
102   }
103
104   private boolean eq(String s1, String s2) {
105      return Utils.eq(!caseSensitive, s1, s2);
106   }
107}
